questions.question: What word makes the browser calculate the margin automatically? For instance, margin: 0, what.
questions.description: auto makes the browser calculate the margin.

questions.question: If h1 is the selector, what is the content inside the brackets called?
questions.description: The declaration includes a CSS property name and a value, separated by a :

questions.question: What property would you use to center an inline element?
questions.description: The text-align property allows you to position inline elements.

questions.question: What does this channel refer to? rgb(255,0,0, this)
questions.description: When specifying an RGB value, the fourth option is an optional alpha channel.

questions.question: When using background-image, how do you link to an image? As in, what do you put before ("kitten.jpg")
questions.description: url allows you to link to a background image.

questions.question: If you do not want a background-image to repeat, what value do you use? background-image: what;
questions.description: The no-repeat value prevents a background image from repeating.

questions.question: When adding a stylesheet, what would be added here? <link what="stylesheet"...>
questions.description: rel is part of linking to an external stylesheet: <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="mystyle.css">

questions.question: When adding padding or margin, what position does the third value effect? padding: 50px, 30px, 10px, 20px
questions.description: The order goes clockwise: top, right, bottom, left.

questions.question: What text-align value stretches each line so all of them have equal width and the left and right margins are straight?
questions.description: The justify value stretches every line to equal width and makes left and right margins that are straight.

questions.question: What property is used to set (or remove) underlines? what: underline;
questions.description: The text-decoration property allows you to add or remove an underline, overline, or line-through.

questions.question: What property is used to make all of the text uppercase? what: uppercase;
questions.description: The text-tranform property allows you to make all the applied to content uppercase or lowercase. It can also capitalize the first letter of each word.

questions.question: What property is used to specify the space between characters in text?
questions.description: letter-spacing specifies the space between characters.

questions.question: What property is used to specify the space between lines?
questions.description: line-height specifies the space between lines.

questions.question: What property is used to specify the space between the words in a text?
questions.description: word-spacing specifies the space between the words in a text.

questions.question: What property is used to specify a font set like Arial or Times New Roman?
questions.description: font-family allows you to decide what font type will be displayed on a web page.

questions.question: If you want to create italic text, what property would you use rather than an <i> tag? what: italic;
questions.description: font-style allows you to make a font italic (or oblique or normal).

questions.question: font-size: 1 what is equal to the default font-size?
questions.description: em is one alternate to pixels. 1em is equal to the default font size.

questions.question: If you want to create small-caps (lowercase to uppercase, but in a smaller font size), what property is used? what:small-caps;
questions.description: font-variant is used to create small-caps.

questions.question: One way to hide elements in CSS is to use display:what;
questions.description: display: none; can be used to hide elements.

questions.question: display: none; can hide an element. What property would you use if you want the space the hidden element was in to remain empty? what: hidden;
questions.description: visibility allows you to hide an element and have it take up the same amount of space as before it was hidden.

questions.question: position:what; means the element will stay in the same place, even if the page is scrolled.
questions.description: position: fixed; is positioned relative to the viewport, making an element stay with the page as it scrolls.

questions.question: position: what; is positioned relative to the nearest positioned ancestor or to the body. If there are none, it is positioned relative to the body.
questions.description: position: absolute; is positioned relative to the nearest positioned ancestor. If there are none, it is positioned relative to the body.

questions.question: The what property is one way to control the behavior of floating elements. It specifies on which sides of an element floating elements are not allowed to float.
questions.description: The clear property is used to control the behavior of floating elements.
